content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a high-rated recipe for gluten-free brownies on Allrecipes with at least 50 reviews. List the main ingredients and the total time required for preparation and cooking.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to search for "gluten-free brownies" on Allrecipes to find a high-rated recipe with at least 50 reviews. The search box is likely element [2], and the search button is [3]. First, I'll enter my search query in the textbox.
Action: Type [2]; gluten-free brownies
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search query for "gluten-free brownies" has been entered, but the search button [3] needs to be clicked to display recipe results. 
Action: Click [3]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results for "gluten-free brownies" are now visible. The first recipe card at [9] is titled "The Best Gluten Free Brownies Ever" and seems promising. I need to open this recipe to check its rating, review count, main ingredients, and total prep/cook time.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The recipe "The Best Gluten Free Brownies Ever...Seriously" has a high rating (4.9) but only 24 reviews, which is less than the required 50 reviews. I need to go back to the search results and try another recipe card that might meet the requirement.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.22
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page did not go back to the search result view. I may need to use the browser back function again or scroll to see if the other search results are visible further down the page.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.96
Completion: 0.22
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results for "gluten-free brownies" are shown with three main recipes displayed horizontally (elements [9], [10], [11]). I already checked [9]. Next, I should check [11], as it is another "Gluten-Free Brownies" recipe and may have sufficient reviews.
Action: Click [11]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This "Gluten-Free Brownies" recipe has only 4 reviews, which is far below the 50 review minimum requirement. I need to go back to the search results and try a different recipe, potentially the one at [10].
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page did not return to the search results. I should try scrolling up or down since the screenshots show that sometimes search results continue off-screen. This might reveal more recipes, one of which may meet the requirement of having at least 50 reviews.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current view only shows a close-up image of brownies, ads, and no additional recipe or navigation options appear here. I need to scroll further to see if more recipes or navigation options show up below.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The total time for preparation and cooking (55 mins) is visible, and the "Ingredients" section is starting to appear at the bottom of the screenshot. To list the main ingredients, I need to scroll further down to reveal the entire ingredients list.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The main ingredients for the gluten-free brownies are now clearly visible. I have also previously captured the total time for preparation and cooking (55 mins). However, based on earlier observations, this recipe does not have at least 50 reviews, which is required by the task. I need to go back to the search results to try another recipe.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results page is now visible again, showing three different gluten-free brownie recipes in a row (elements [9], [11], [13]). I have already checked [9] and [11], so now I should try [13] to see if it meets the review requirement.
Action: Click [13]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This "Gluten-Free Brownies" recipe also has only 4 reviews (element [19]), which is far less than the required 50. No recipes so far have met the review requirement from these first few results. I need to try to find more results, possibly by scrolling down to see additional recipes.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still do not see additional recipes or more information about reviews. The visible portion continues to show the current recipe's image and some ads. I need to scroll down further to locate either more gluten-free brownie recipes or pagination options that can help access additional recipes, which may have more reviews.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The total time (55 mins) and servings (10) are visible, but the "Ingredients" section shows a message stating "Oops! We can't find any ingredients ... near you," which means the ingredient list is not displayed. I still have not found a recipe that meets the requirements (at least 50 reviews) and need to see more search results to do so.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Scrolling up only brings the view back to the image section of the same recipe, without revealing previous or additional recipes. It's likely more search results or page navigation are located further up or down on this page, or I may need to return to the homepage/search again to try more recipes.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The recipe shown has only 4 reviews, much less than the required minimum of 50 reviews. I need to find more gluten-free brownie recipes that might meet the review requirement. The search textbox [2] and magnifying glass search button [3] are visible, so I can directly search for "gluten-free brownies" again for a broader list of results.
Action: Type [2]; gluten-free brownies
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.72

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Main menu for Allrecipes";	[1]: "Allrecipes", "Visit Allrecipes' homepage";	[2]: <input> "";	[3]: <button> "Click to search";	[4]: "Log In";	[7]: <button> "Clear search";	[8]: <input> "";

content:
Thought: The search results for "gluten-free brownies" are displayed again, showing three recipes as before: [9], [10], and [11]. All previously checked recipes did not meet the minimum review requirement. I need to look for more results by scrolling down the page, as additional results may appear further down.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.75

content:
Thought: The visible recipes and their ratings are displayed, but none of them show a review count of 50 or more. The top left recipe, "The Best Gluten Free Brownies Ever...Seriously," has only 25 ratings. To find a recipe that meets the requirement, I should continue scrolling down to look for options with at least 50 reviews.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.78

Thought: None of the visible gluten-free brownie recipes have more than 3 ratings, which is far below the requirement of at least 50 reviews. There still may be more results further down the page, so I should scroll down again to search for a suitable recipe.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.8
